thread.title: Ashley Barnes claims Sunderland could be TOUGHER for Burnley than Liverpool were last Sunday
thread.title_full: Ashley Barnes claims Sunderland could be TOUGHER for Burnley than Liverpool were last Sunday

author: David Anderson
title: Ashley Barnes claims Sunderland could be TOUGHER for Burnley than Liverpool were last Sunday
text:
Sport Ashley Barnes claims Sunderland could be TOUGHER for Burnley than Liverpool were last Sunday "It will be a completely different game, sometimes you have to win ugly and we need to make sure we come away with the points" Share Ashley Barnes says Sunderland present a totally-different challenge to playing Liverpool at Anfield (Photo: Reuters) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Ashley Barnes claims Sunderland could be tougher for Burnley than Liverpool were last Sunday. 
Barnes is wary of facing Sunderland at the Stadium of Light on Saturday because David Moyes' men are scrapping for survival. 
And the Clarets striker says they will present a totally-different challenge to playing Liverpool at Anfield . 
"It could be tougher than Liverpool," said Barnes. "Sunderland are fighting for their lives and so are we, so it's going to be a massive game. 
"It will be a completely different game, sometimes you have to win ugly and we need to make sure we come away with the points." Barnes opened the scoring at Anfield on Sunday (Photo: REUTERS) Barnes opened the scoring at Anfield on Sunday (Photo: Peter Byrne/PA Wire) Barnes opened the scoring at Anfield on Sunday (Photo: AFP) 
Rock-bottom Sunderland seem ideal opponents for Burnley to register that elusive first Premier League away win of the season and the Clarets hammered them 4-1 at Turf Moor on New Year's Eve. 
But Barnes is not expecting such an easy afternoon on Wearside. 
"What happened at our place, it's not going to be that easy, so we've got to be switched on," he said. 
"I don't think that will count. We're on an equal footing next week and we need to make sure we come away with the three points. 
"We go into every away game wanting to win and we went into Liverpool wanting to win, but it just didn't happen. 
"It's the rub of the green. The luck will change for us if we keep performing against the top sides like we have done." poll loading Will Burnley finish in the top half? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
